intro: Machadoa, commonly known as the white hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Machadoa species are perennial herbs with basal leaves and are often found in mountainous regions.
